base_prompt:
Scientific diagram in the Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid tradition. A stylized basin topology icon rendered as if from a Capital Archive mathematical treatise.

COMPOSITION:
- Circular frame containing {contour_count} nested contour lines
- Contours represent stability basin (like a topographic bullseye)
- Center is the deepest point (attractor)
- Viewed from directly above (plan view)

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Contour lines: Slate (#1A202C), uniform thin weight
- Outer region: Terrain Blue (#2C5282)
- Middle region: Transitional teal (#319795)
- Inner region (basin floor): Elevation Yellow (#ECC94B)
- Background: {background_color}

STYLE:
- Clean vector-like rendering
- Geometric precision with cartographic terrain coloring
- No shadows, no gradients within regions (flat color fills)
- Contour lines evenly spaced, mathematically regular

CONSTRAINTS:
- Must be readable at {min_size} pixels
- No text or labels
- No decorative elements
- High contrast for dark mode compatibility

EXCLUDE: Photorealism, 3D perspective, gradients within regions, decorative borders, any text
example_filled: Scientific diagram in the Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid tradition. A stylized basin topology icon rendered as if from a Capital Archive mathematical treatise. COMPOSITION: Circular frame containing three nested contour lines. Contours represent stability basin. Center is the deepest point. Viewed from directly above. MATERIALS: Contour lines Slate (#1A202C). Outer region Terrain Blue (#2C5282). Middle region teal (#319795). Inner region Elevation Yellow (#ECC94B). Background Precise White (#F7FAFC). STYLE: Clean vector-like, geometric precision, no shadows, flat color fills. CONSTRAINTS: Readable at 32px, no text, no decoration, high contrast. EXCLUDE: Photorealism, 3D, gradients, borders, text.
notes: Primary avatar template - test at multiple scales

base_prompt:
Scientific illustration in the Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid tradition. A section of mathematical morphospace rendered as explorable terrain.

COMPOSITION:
- Landscape orientation ({dimensions})
- Terrain viewed from elevated angle (20-30 degrees from horizontal)
- {basin_count} stability basins visible as valleys
- Ridge lines connecting basin boundaries
- Central area relatively flat for text overlay zone
- Left and right thirds contain more dramatic terrain

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Contour lines: Slate (#1A202C), thin precise weight
- Lowest elevations: Terrain Blue (#2C5282)
- Low-medium: Teal (#319795)
- Medium: Elevation Yellow (#ECC94B)
- Medium-high: Warm Orange (#DD6B20)
- Background/sky: Subtle gradient to Precise White (#F7FAFC)

STYLE:
- Clean technical illustration with terrain shading
- Hillshade effect (light from upper left)
- Contour lines at regular intervals
- Mathematical precision meets landscape beauty

TEXT ZONE:
- Central {text_zone_width}px should be calm terrain
- Avoid high-contrast elements in center

LANDMARKS (optional): {landmarks}

EXCLUDE: Photorealistic textures, dramatic atmosphere, creatures, dense labels
example_filled: Scientific illustration in Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid tradition. Morphospace terrain, 1280x640 aspect ratio. Elevated view (25 degrees). Multiple stability basins as valleys, ridge lines between. Central 640px is calm for text. Colors: Contours Slate (#1A202C), depths Terrain Blue (#2C5282), rises through Teal to Elevation Yellow (#ECC94B). Hillshade from upper left. Optional: small Tower of Mirado suggestion on distant ridge. EXCLUDE: photorealism, atmosphere, creatures, labels.
notes: Primary banner template - ensure text zone clarity

base_prompt:
Course series header in {school_name} tradition for {series_name}.

LAYOUT:
- Dimensions: {dimensions}
- Left zone ({left_width}px): {icon_description}
- Center zone ({center_width}px): Title '{series_title}' with tagline '{tagline}'
- Right zone ({right_width}px): {decorative_description}

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Primary: {primary_hex} ({primary_name})
- Secondary: {secondary_hex} ({secondary_name})
- Accent: {accent_hex} ({accent_name})
- Background: {background_treatment}

STYLE:
- {style_notes}
- Publication-quality rendering
- Consistent with Densworld illustration traditions

TYPOGRAPHY:
- Title: Clean sans-serif, prominent
- Tagline: Lighter weight, secondary

CONSTRAINTS:
- Icons must be readable at reduced sizes
- Text zone must remain clear for overlay
- Cohesive composition across three zones

EXCLUDE: {exclusions}
example_filled: Course series header in Notation-Cartographic Hybrid tradition for Philosophy Series. LAYOUT: 1200x300px. Left (200px): I-C-integral formula fragment. Center (800px): 'Philosophy Series' with 'ML Through Speculative Philosophy'. Right (200px): Basin terrain contours. COLORS: Primary Archive Blue (#2B6CB0), Secondary Elevation Yellow (#ECC94B), Accent Forest Green (#276749). White background. STYLE: Publication precision meets terrain exploration. Clean sans-serif title. EXCLUDE: decorative flourishes, photorealism.
notes: Master template for all series headers - customize per series

example_filled: Scientific illustration in Organic School tradition by Yeller Quarry field naturalist. SUBJECT: Wharver, three-quarter view. Features: globed lizard body, fin array, leathery sack form, glinting hook scales, hot belly. MATERIALS: Variable lines in Toadpipe Bile ink on Quarry paper (#DEB887). Primary: Wharver Scale Rust (#92400E). Secondary: Quarry Ochre (#B45309). Accents: hot belly glow suggestion. STYLE: Living mathematics, flowing curves, variable line weight on fins. NOTATION: 'Wharver specimen' in field script. Scale: 'forearm length'. EXCLUDE: dramatic lighting, photorealism, decoration.
notes: Best for Quarry creatures with distinctive features

base_prompt:
Scientific illustration in the Geometric School tradition, rendered as if for Capital Archive taxonomic records.

SUBJECT: {creature_name}
- Depicted in precise {pose}
- All taxonomically significant features visible: {features}

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Line work: Uniform weight iron gall ink (#1A202C)
- Paper: Archive-standard white (#FFFFFF)
- Primary color: {primary_hex}
- Secondary color: {secondary_hex}
- Limited palette for clarity

STYLE:
- Clarity above all
- Precise anatomical rendering
- Uniform line weight throughout
- No shadows, flat even lighting
- Orthographic projection preferred

NOTATION:
- Species name in Archive hand
- Key features labeled with thin leader lines
- Scale bar included
- Catalog number: {catalog_id}

COMPOSITION:
- Side view (profile) preferred for taxonomy
- Specimen isolated on white background
- Generous margin for notation

EXCLUDE: Artistic interpretation, dramatic poses, environmental context, gradients
example_filled: Scientific illustration in Geometric School for Capital Archive. SUBJECT: Grimslew, precise side view. Features: fifty fins, twin tails, leathery sack body, hook scales with rust patina. MATERIALS: Uniform iron gall ink (#1A202C) on Archive white (#FFFFFF). Primary: Grimslew dark (#2A2A2A). Secondary: rust patina (#92400E). STYLE: Clarity above all, precise anatomy, uniform lines, flat lighting, orthographic. NOTATION: 'Grimslew' in Archive hand, features labeled, scale bar, catalog HV-001. EXCLUDE: artistic interpretation, drama, environment, gradients.
notes: Best for dangerous/taxonomic specimens requiring precision

base_prompt:
Educational diagram in Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid style showing basin topology concepts.

SUBJECT: {concept_name}
- {basin_count} basins with clear boundaries
- Gradient flow arrows showing trajectories
- {special_features}

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Contour lines: Slate (#1A202C)
- Basin floors (attractors): Terrain Blue (#2C5282)
- Basin walls: Gradient through Teal (#319795) to Yellow (#ECC94B)
- Ridges/saddles: Warm Orange (#DD6B20)
- Flow arrows: {arrow_color}
- Background: Precise White (#F7FAFC)

STYLE:
- Topographic map aesthetic
- Mathematical precision
- Clear hierarchy of visual elements
- Educational clarity

NOTATION:
- Basin labels in clean sans-serif
- Key mathematical points marked
- Legend if multiple element types

COMPOSITION:
- Elevated view (30-45 degrees)
- All basins visible
- Flow patterns clear

EXCLUDE: Photorealism, decorative elements, ambiguous boundaries
example_filled: Educational diagram in Geometric-Cartographic Hybrid showing stability basins. SUBJECT: Keth Basin Topology. Three basins with clear boundaries. Gradient flow arrows showing trajectories toward attractors. Saddle point between basins marked. COLORS: Contours Slate (#1A202C), basin floors Terrain Blue (#2C5282), walls gradient to Yellow (#ECC94B), ridges Orange (#DD6B20), arrows Forest Green (#276749). Background white. STYLE: Topographic precision, educational clarity. NOTATION: Basins labeled 'A' 'B' 'C', saddle point marked, legend for arrow types. Elevated view. EXCLUDE: photorealism, decoration, ambiguity.

base_prompt:
Educational diagram in Organic-Notation Hybrid style showing network relationships.

SUBJECT: {concept_name}
- {node_count} nodes representing {node_type}
- Edges showing {relationship_type}
- {cluster_description}

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Nodes: Flow Green (#276749) with Connection Teal (#319795) borders
- Positive edges: Forest Green (#276749) solid lines
- Negative edges: Muted Red (#C53030) dashed lines
- Labels: Label Black (#1A202C)
- Background: Warm Gradient (#FEFCBF) subtle

STYLE:
- Organic layout (force-directed aesthetic)
- Flowing curves for edges
- Soft glow around node clusters
- Breathing mathematics feel

NOTATION:
- Node labels in clean type
- Edge weights if applicable
- Cluster boundaries as soft regions

COMPOSITION:
- Clusters visually grouped
- Negative relationships cross cluster boundaries
- Central focus on key relationships

EXCLUDE: Rigid grid layout, harsh angles, photorealism
example_filled: Educational diagram in Organic-Notation Hybrid showing Tross Constellation Method. SUBJECT: Creature Affinity Network. 15 nodes representing Quarry creatures. Edges showing behavioral relationships (positive=cooperation, negative=predation). Three clusters: prey species, predators, symbionts. COLORS: Nodes Flow Green with Teal borders. Positive edges green solid. Negative edges red dashed. Labels black. Warm gradient background. STYLE: Organic force-directed layout, flowing edge curves, soft cluster glow. NOTATION: Creature names on nodes, edge thickness for strength. EXCLUDE: grid layout, harsh angles, photorealism.

base_prompt:
Educational diagram in Notation Scribes style showing hierarchical structure.

SUBJECT: {concept_name}
- {level_count} levels in hierarchy
- {level_descriptions}
- Integration relationships between levels

MATERIALS AND COLORS:
- Primary structure: Black (#1A202C)
- Defined terms: Blue (#2B6CB0)
- Derived elements: Green (#276749)
- Boundaries: Thin black lines
- Background: White (#FFFFFF)

STYLE:
- Publication-quality precision
- Clean nested boxes or brackets
- Integrated mathematical notation
- LaTeX-compatible aesthetic

NOTATION:
- Level labels in formal type
- Mathematical relationships annotated
- I-C-integral integration symbol if applicable

COMPOSITION:
- Top-down or left-right hierarchy
- Clear parent-child relationships
- Visual weight reflects importance

EXCLUDE: Decorative elements, organic curves, gradients, ambiguity
optional_variables: Educational diagram in Notation Scribes style showing TAME Hierarchy. SUBJECT: Anster's Hierarchy of Minds. Four levels: Traces (T), Agents (A), Minds (M), Environments (E). Each level contains and integrates the lower. COLORS: Structure black (#1A202C), defined terms blue (#2B6CB0), derived green (#276749), white background. STYLE: Publication precision, nested boxes, integrated I-C-integral notation. NOTATION: Level names, integration arrows, Anster's formula. Top-down hierarchy. EXCLUDE: decoration, organic curves, gradients.
